Pre-Game Insights: Toni Kroos is retiring after the tournament, and this trophy would round out his trophy set.
Germany is heavily favored to win at home against Scotland.
Scotland is a good embodiment of the expanded Euro field, having made two out of three times since the 2016 tournament.
Germany hasn’t played a competitive match since the shocking group stage exit at the 2022 World Cup.
Germany has six wins, three draws and six defeats in friendlies since then.
Germany beat France and the Netherlands in back-to-back matches in March.
Germany is in need of a good result at a tournament, not only because of the host status but because Germany has not had good results in recent tournaments.
Germany went out in the group stage in the last two World Cups and lost in the Round of 16 at the last Euros.
Germany is even money to make the semifinals in this tournament.
Plenty of eyes will be on Toni Kroos, the German midfielder who is retiring after the tournament.
Toni Kroos won everything possible in Germany and Spain during his club career and was on Germany’s 2014 World Cup-winning squad, but has never won the Euros.
Germany is behind only England and France in the odds to win the tournament and is heavily favored to win Group A.
Scotland is the longshot in the group, with the longest odds to win the group (+1000) and to advance (-110).
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland managed a draw and two losses in the 2020 (2021*) edition, but did not score a goal.
Scotland beat Spain 2-0 in Glasgow and only suffered one defeat in eight qualifying matches, which was a 2-0 loss at Spain.
Germany is heavily favored to win at home, but the odds are a bit silly due to the hold taken by sportsbooks.
Some of the more balanced groups on paper have minus-odds for all four teams due to the hold taken by sportsbooks.
Even if two-thirds of the 24-team Euro 2024 field will make it to the knockout stage, some teams have minus-odds to advance.
The Scots made two of the 12 the Euros (1992, 1996) from 1968-2012.
Scotland has made it two out of three times since the 2016 tournament.
The 2024 Euro opening match is on Friday, with the host Germans opening against Scotland in Group A play in the Allianz Arena in Munich.
The tournament hits a three-match-per-day cadence for the next three days after the opening match.
